intro: Psychotria anceps var. robustior, commonly known as the "Coca plant," is a flowering plant species native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, tubular flowers. The plant is notable for its alkaloid content, particularly cocaine, which is found in the leaves. It thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soil. Due to its psychoactive properties, it is both economically significant and subject to strict legal regulations.
